Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.
Octopuses have three hearts. Two pump blood to the gills, and one pumps it to the rest of the body.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries are not.
Polar bears are nearly undetectable by infrared cameras, thanks to their transparent fur.
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when they're separated.
The shortest war in history lasted 38 to 45 minutes between Britain and Zanzibar on August 27, 1896.
Some cats are allergic to humans.
Koalas have fingerprints that are nearly indistinguishable from human fingerprints.
In space, there is a giant cloud of alcohol containing enough ethyl alcohol to fill 400 trillion trillion pints of beer.
A newborn kangaroo is about 1 inch long, or the size of a lima bean.
There are more possible iterations of a game of chess than there are atoms in the known universe.
It is impossible to hum while holding your nose closed.
Vending machines are more deadly than sharks.
Pteronophobia is the fear of being tickled by feathers.
The average person spends six months of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.
Cows have best friends and can become stressed when they're separated.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
A single strand of spaghetti is called a 'spaghetto'.
A day on Venus is longer than its year.
The longest time between two twins being born is 87 days.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped to prevent it from rolling away.
The total weight of ants on Earth once equaled the total weight of all humans.
Hawaii moves toward Japan 4 inches every year.
Some fungi create zombies, then control their minds.
The French language has 17 different words for 'surrender'.
